title: 2022 FIFA World Cup
description: From a dataset of all matches' statistics, there is a complete exploratory analysis using Python that leads to an outstanding understanding of what was this last World Cup.

title: 2022 SISU registrations analysis
description: This Jupyter Notebook refers to a general overview regarding how the 2022 SISU successful candidates, as well as their grades by area of ​​knowledge, are distributed throughout Brazil.

title: Binary classification model
description: A credit granting risk model for deciding wheter to grant the requested credit to a client. The datasets used were analysed in an exploratory way and also visualised before model training.

title: API for ML model monitoring
description: An API implemented in python for volumetry and model score monitoring, as well as datasets adherence. The endpoint are specified in the repository.

title: A data visualiser
description: A web application for graphical visualization of the formatted input data. It is a simple but complete client server application to consolidate the knowledges surrounding web development.

title: ResNet50 and image compression
description: The ResNet50 model from tensorflow has its performance tested in this project. Using the K-Means unsupervised learning algorithm, this model behaviour is analysed while classifying k-clustered compressed images.

title: Autonomous Search Agent
description: This p5.js project visually represents this autonomous agent whose purpose is to seek the food inside a completely observable environment considering the most common searching algorithms.

title: A password manager
description: An application that allows managing various login and password data and registering them RSA-encrypted into an SQL database, using the python sqlite3 module, through an interactive python tkinter GUI.

title: A relational database
description: This SQL project stands for managing students and professors' data while members of an university. The final model implements both DDL and DML statements.
